post.author: 박성민
post.content:
한번씩 풀어보시기 바랍니다.문제가 쉬우시면 네트워크 기초가 튼튼하신 편이고..어렵다고 느끼시면 세미나에 참석이 필요(?)한 것으로 진단됩니다... 답은 마지막 아래에..
Question 1 CSMA/CD stands for - a) Collision Single-Multiple Access with Carrier Detection b) Collision Sense Multiple Access with Carrier Detection c) Carrier Single-Multiple Access with Collision Detection d) Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Detection
Question 2 On Ethernet LANs, the Ethernet address is also known as the - a) IP address b) MAC address c) virtual address d) other
Question 3 What is the basic unit of Ethernet traffic? a) file b) frame c) packet d) stream
Question 4 Can IP run over any other physical networks besides Ethernet? a) No (and IP does not run over Ethernet) b) No c) Yes (but IP does not run over Ethernet) d) Yes
Question 5 Which central authority is responsible for allocating IP addresses on the Internet? a) IETF b) IANA c) IEEE d) none of the above
Question 6 Which of the following IPv4 addresses is the loopback address? a) 0.0.0.0 b) 10.0.0.1 c) 127.0.0.1 d) 255.255.255.255
Question 7 The IP delivery service is - a) reliable, connection-oriented b) non-routable c) unreliable, connectionless d) none of the above
Question 8 22. Which of the following IP address ranges are considered part of the Class A network? a) 0.0.0.0 - 126.255.255.255 b) 1.0.0.0 - 127.255.255.255 c) 1.0.0.0 - 126.255.255.255 d) 0.0.0.0 - 127.255.255.255
Question 9 CIDR stands for - a) Class-Based Internet Domain Routing b) Careful Inter-Domain Routing c) Constant Internet Domain Routing d) Classless Inter-Domain Routing
Question 10 In CIDR notation, which of the following Class C networks contains host 192.168.14.2? a) 192.168.10.0/22 b) 192.168.11.0/21 c) 192.168.12.0/23 d) 192.168.13.0/24
Question 11 Each of the four numeric fields of an IP address written in dotted-decimal notation is also known as - a) octet b) word c) subnet d) class
Question 12 The Class D network range is reserved on the Internet for - a) broadcast b) multicast c) anycast d) none of the above
Question 13 What is the size of the next-generation (IPv6) IP address? a) 4 bytes (32 bits) b) 12 bytes (96 bits) c) 15 bytes (120 bits) d) 16 bytes (128 bits)
Question 14 Which of the following IPv6 addresses is the loopback address? a) 0::0 b) 0::1 c) 127::0 d) 127::1
Question 15 In IPv6, the anycast feature allows - a) senders to address packets to all nodes in a group b) senders to address to packets to any member of a group of nodes c) receivers to listen for any given packet on the network d) receivers to announce their presence to potential senders
Question 16 TCP offers which of the following benefits relative to UDP? a) TCP allows much larger packets to be sent over the network, improving application performance b) TCP includes a "retry" mechanism to prevent missing (dropped) packets c) TCP uses a smaller header than does UDP d) none of the above
Question 17 The term - broadcast domain - best describes what group of devices or users? a) The routers that allow broadcasts from being forwarded. b) The switches that allow broadcasts to be forwarded. c) The hosts and network devices that will receive all broadcasts sent on a given network segment. d) The segment of a network where there is a possibility that all devices will send broadcasts simultaneously.
Question 18 How do routers handle broadcasts? a) Routers forward broadcasts by default. b) Routers forward broadcasts only to local hosts. c) Routers forward broadcasts if configured with the -forward-broadcast - command. d) Routers do not forward broadcasts.
Question 19 Which of the following are typically used to break up a collision domain? A. Routers B. Bridges C. Switches D. Hubs E. Repeaters
Question 20 Which protocols are correctly matched for devices? a) STP(Spanning Tree Protocol) for routers, OSPF(Open Shortest Path First) for switches . a) STP(Spanning Tree Protocol) for switches, OSPF(Open Shortest Path First) for routers . b) OSPF and VTP(VLAN Trunk Protocol) for routers. c) STP and VTP for routers.
================================================== Question 1 => (d)
Question 2 => (b)
Question 3 => (b)
Question 4 => (d)
Question 5 => (b)
Question 6 => (c)
Question 7 => (c)
Question 8 => (c)
Question 9 => (d)
Question 10 => (b)
Question 11 => (a)
Question 12 => (b)
Question 13 => (d)
Question 14 => (b)
Question 15 => (b)
Question 16 => (b)
Question 17 => (c)
Question 18 => (d)
Question 19 => (b) (c)
Question 20 => (b)
post.title: 연습문제...
